Crimes.Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness rights by immigration officer
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, S.C. 2001, c. 27
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visitor visa and failed to attend initial proceedings; represented by counsel and understood English
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national with expired visitor visa
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failed to attend initial proceedings; claimed lack of notice and need for interpreter
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged lack of procedural fairness, including notice and interpreter rights
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Applicant's comprehension of English and representation by counsel
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 29(2); Regulation 228
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Notice and right to interpreter in administrative proceedings
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Attendance record, counsel representation, language proficiency
Crimes.Application_Basis: Mandatory exclusion order for visa overstay
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Failure to appear, understanding of process
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Exclusion order mandatory upon inadmissibility for overstaying
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No evidence of lack of notice or misunderstanding
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: None found due to lawful process
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed visa and was deemed inadmissible
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Proper consideration of attendance and comprehension
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of immigration officer to issue exclusion order
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Credible evidence of compliance with procedures
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No breach of procedural fairness; statutory requirements met

Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under subsection 29(2) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness rights by immigration officer
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, S.C. 2001, c. 27
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visa, attended later proceedings with counsel, claimed lack of notice, interpreter issues, and ignored H&C factors
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national found inadmissible under IRPA
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Overstayed visa, failed initial appearance, later participated with legal representation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged procedural unfairness regarding notice, interpretation, and humanitarian considerations
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness; separation between exclusion orders and H&C assessment
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Understanding of English, presence of counsel, timing of appearances
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Obligation to provide interpreter and consider H&C in exclusion context
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Record of attendance, legal representation, language ability
Crimes.Application_Basis: Mandatory exclusion for foreign nationals found inadmissible under subsection 29(2)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Compliance with procedural fairness despite absence at first hearing
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Overturn exclusion order based on alleged procedural defects
Crimes.Governing_Rule: No duty to inform of interpreter if comprehension evident; H&C not part of exclusion order
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No proof of misunderstanding or prejudice
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed visitor status and was deemed inadmissible
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Proper evaluation of participation and understanding
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Scope of immigration officer’s authority under IRPA
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Procedural fairness upheld; exclusion mandatory upon inadmissibility
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Administrative law principles of procedural fairness

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with residency obligation under section 28
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness in issuing exclusion order
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visa and failed to attend initial proceedings; submitted H&C application but excluded without IAD referral
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Exclusion order issued without IAD referral
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national subject to residency obligations
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Did not meet residency requirements, failed to appear initially
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural unfairness concerning notice, interpretation, discretion, and H&C considerations
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nature of violation (solely overstay), statutory mandate for exclusion
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Requirement for referral to IAD when other grounds exist
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No indication of bad faith or misunderstanding
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Visa status records, attendance history, H&C submission
Crimes.Application_Basis: Exclusion required where inadmissibility is solely due to overstay
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Compliance with statutory procedures for exclusion
Crimes.Governing_Rule: No IAD referral needed if sole basis is overstay under section 28
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed visitor visa and failed residency compliance
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Proper handling of documentation and procedural steps
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority to issue exclusion without IAD involvement
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Statutory exclusion applied correctly; no procedural breach
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Standard of reasonableness in judicial review
